data.title: Speed up TraitContainer.RemoveActor.
data.body:
Find the actor to remove faster by using the binary search.

Remove the actor and traits faster by removing from the lists in a bulk operation.

data.title: [TS] Option for Day / Night behaver based on realtime timezone
data.body:
A nice feature would be when we have an option to set, that the Lighting (Day & Night) relates to the Realtime :)

So when it is night in Real so the game will also switch to night and reverse :) 
depending on the clock we could make the game more relalistical :) 

So we can "change the experience" in campain missions ... 
- We could define Objectives for night and Day
- Maybe other

data.title: Fix missing first animation frame and remove DeadBuildingState.
Fixed AppVeyor deploying and failing the build
data.body: Looking at https://ci.appveyor.com/project/OpenRA/openra/build/1.0.1049 something is going wrong. This fixes the indention (not sure if that is causing a problem) and adding another condition documented at http://www.appveyor.com/docs/deployment#deploy-on-tag-github-only

data.title: Aircraft attack move issues
data.body:
If a Yak or a Mig is given attack move order and there is a target on the way, it attacks the target and then comes back to airfield to rearm. After rearming it continues the attack move starting from the airfield. This happens once and after that it comes back to base and just circles above construction yard and doesn't rearm or go to the attack move location.

Helicopters have a different behaviour. After they attack the target and run out of ammo, they come back to helipad, rearm and continue the attack move. If they encounter another target (or the same target), they attack it and come back to helipad for the second time. But instead of landing and rearming, they immediately skip to the attack move once they arrive at helipad. Since they carry out the attack move without ammo they come back to helipad at first enemy encounter and this repeats as a loop. 

Aircraft attack move works if a second airfield/helipad is built. After that it does this rearming and attack moving action until no target remains along the path and it arrives at attack move location.

I think the reason is that the airfield/helipad is reserved for some reason after the first rearming and the aircraft can't land. It is also not possible to give a manual landing order. When a second airfield/helipad is built it works.

This happens in latest release and playtest.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/8596577-aircraft-attack-move-issues?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add race-specific sequence support, and overhaul D2K actor definitions.
data.body:
This pr can be divided into three parts:
1. Fix the propagation of `RaceInit` between producer → producee (which only works in about half of the required cases on current bleed).
2. Add support for race-specific sprite sequences (this can eventually be switched out for a more generic implementation using upgrades).
3. Merge the duplicated D2K actors, and reorganize the definitions to be more consistent with the other mods.

This significantly simplifies the D2K mod rules, and should make it easier to deal with in the future as we work through reimplementing the original tech tree and balance.  It also fixes a bunch of inconsistencies that have grown in the rules over the years (mismatched actor name cases, redundant prerequisites defined on only some actors, duplicated traits on inherited actors, etc).

The main change gameplay-wise is that you must now capture (or build in debug-mode) an enemy construction yard and make it primary (mouseover and deploy) in order to produce a different faction's structures.  The build icons in the sidebar show what faction's structures you are building. The same applies for building faction-specific MCVs (they inherit the race of the factory that build them).  The race of actors placed in the map editor can be set using the Race: initializer, otherwise it will be determined based on the owner.  The ingame map editor will eventually be able to set this (together with other properties such as the facing, owner, health) in an actor-properties panel.

Fixes #3699, #7274.  Closes #7452.

This is a monster of a PR, so my apologies to the people reviewing this.  @penev92 has helped me test this over the last week, and I think we've identified and fixed most of the regressions.  I expect there may be a few we've missed, however.

data.title: TS UI
data.body:
In order to help developers get rid of the old UI code https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7461, I have started a draft, a first attempt at making a TS UI. It may or may not be be final UI (I don't know yet), but we'll see.

Current branch:
https://github.com/x-a-n-a-x/OpenRA/commits/new-TS-UI

As you can see, it's far from being finished and there are still bugs with some coordinates in chrome.yaml or ingame-player.yaml files. But little by little, I try to fix problems. 

![screen shot 02-14-15 at 08 25 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/6200789/cda2f5a4-b487-11e4-863d-36ba1283a52d.PNG)

data.title: D2k actor duplicates from Starport break the Select Units hotkey
data.body:
This has been around for a long time and has always bugged me, but it's not very high on my TODO list. Hopefully someone can take care of it.
The problem:
Right now we have duplicate actors for everything that can be purchased from the starport:
Actor `Trike` and actor `Trike.Starport` are identical, except for their prerequisites and build queue.
Having 5 of each type, selecting one and pressing the Select Units hotkey (`W` by default) will only select 5 trikes, because the actor type names are different.

Just in case someone decides to fix this and needs a pointer:
**Option 1:**

> [20:52] <+pchote> Probably wouldn't be hard to add support for multiple buildable traits
> [20:52] <+pchote> Which would do it
> [20:52] <+pchote> May not be the best solution though

**Option 2:**

> [20:53] <+pchote> Another idea would be some kind of production proxy trait
> [20:53] <+pchote> Which the producer checks for on creation, and replaces the actor
> [20:56] <+pchote> That would be even easier implementation wise, but maybe a bit ugly from an architectural pov

**Option 3:**

> [21:01] <+pchote> There's only two ways this can be fixed
> [21:01] <+pchote> Either on the production side like ^, or by making the selection code able to consider equivalence over multiple types
> [21:01] <+pchote> Without making that end slow
> [21:04] <penev> now that ^ would be hacky

data.title: Better Airdrop production [Superseded]
data.body:
This is a direct successor to #7061, with the remaining requested changes and some refactoring by me.
This adds support for multiple-actor delivery to ProductionAirdrop and moves it to Mods.Common.
This does (should) not change the current behavior at all. Only lays the foundations for the upcoming Bulk production.

P.S.: Also now the delivery aircraft will wait at the drop location while the "produced" actor exits before flying off (in case the exit is blocked and the actor can't exit right away).

data.title: Brace style fixes
data.body: Applies brace style fixes, thanks to my new rules I'm writing for Stylecop.

data.title: Friendly and owned spy insignia (from Mental Omega).
data.body:
The popular RA2 mod Mental Omega gives spys a special insignia that denote that the actor is:
a) A spy
b) An allied unit (or owned by you)

This insignia is not visible to enemies and cannot be 'discovered' even if the disguise is discovered.

![Screenshot](http://mentalomega.com/images/news_img/item_insignia.jpg)

data.title: Fix extent of buildable area below structures
data.body:
Restore use of `GetBuildingAt` to take bibs into account for buildable area, and only consult the actor map if the actor at that location is not a building.

Fixes #7459.

data.title: Remove legacy sidebar code
Fix soviet sidebar regression
data.body:
This fixes two visual regressions introduced by #7227:
1. The disabled queue background was switched to the grey (observer) button type.
2. The left corners of the selected queue button would glitch when moused over.

It's rather depressing that this wasn't picked up during review or the more than two weeks that it's been broken on bleed :(
